modName: Spooky Edits - Darker Thieves Guild Armor
descriptionHtml:
[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Description :[/b][/color] More darker duds for skulking around in.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Optional Normal Map Fix :[/b][/color] The depth axis of the gloves was inverted in the vanilla texture and I annoyingly missed it for the main files, install after / overwrite my files so the straps etc don't look like they are carved into the gloves (check first screenshot).

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Installation :[/b][/color] Since this is only a texture replacing mod you can just extract to your data folder / install using a mod manager as normal.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Lossless Versions :[/b][/color] These 24bit versions give a nicer depth to the textures and should be free from any artifacts, but are much more memory intensive so if you are already low on V-RAM then avoid :).

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Screenshots :[/b][/color] I always use the lossless versions of my textures alongside an edited [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30936/?/]RealVision Nova ENB[/url] with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?/]Enhanced Lights And FX[/url].



[center][b](: More Spooky Edits :)[/b]
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57178/?]

files.changelogHtml: I re-did the textures aiming for something less extremely dark and closer to vanilla and added player only versions so you can mix and match. I might used 0.1 textures for my character and 0.2 for the guild personally, not sure :)
